intro: Strigosella scorpioides var. multisiliqua, commonly known as the multibracted strigosella, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, often in open habitats such as slopes and grasslands. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small and white, arranged in compound umbels. This variety is distinguished by its multiple bracts along the flowering stems, contributing to its unique appearance.
